page.title: 15CRIME IN CODICOTE/WELWYN
page.content: The area of Welwyn consists largely of residential housing with a commuting population, giving rise to burglaries during the daytime and often attracting criminals from the Metropolitan area. Codicote being of a more rural nature attracts poachers to the area for pheasants, deer and rabbits. Like all areas, thefts from motor vehicles are rife and the presence of a beat bobby is of little deterrent in this aspect. Unlike large conurbations crime is of a spasmodic nature. There is a very small coloured popu_ lation who fit in happily in the area. The Magistrates Court at Hatfield serves the area, with more serious crime being referred to the Crown Court at St. Albans or in some cases to Bedford.
